events.name: EV battery power usage
events.wd_description: The role and utilization of battery power in both internal combustion and electric vehicles, highlighting the replacement of the fuel tank with lithium-ion batteries in electric vehicles.
events.description: The role and utilization of battery power in both internal combustion and electric vehicles, highlighting the replacement of the fuel tank with lithium-ion batteries in electric vehicles.

events.name: Internal combustion vehicle functions
events.wd_description: Battery power used for starting the engine and other functions such as electronic fuel injection, ignition of lights, and air conditioning.
events.description: Battery power used for starting the engine and other functions such as electronic fuel injection, ignition of lights, and air conditioning.

events.name: Electric vehicle functions
events.wd_description: Battery power responsible for supplying power to the electric engine, replacing the fuel tank with lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Battery power responsible for supplying power to the electric engine, replacing the fuel tank with lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Lithium-ion battery advantages
events.wd_description: Advantages of lithium-ion batteries, including high power level, energy per mass unit, and suitability for applications where size and weight are important.
events.description: Advantages of lithium-ion batteries, including high power level, energy per mass unit, and suitability for applications where size and weight are important.

events.name: High power level
events.wd_description: Lithium batteries have higher power levels due to lithium being a small and light element.
events.description: Lithium batteries have higher power levels due to lithium being a small and light element.

events.name: Energy efficiency
events.wd_description: Energy efficiency of lithium-ion batteries provides electric vehicles with a range of up to 150 km and can withstand up to 2000 recharge cycles.
events.description: Energy efficiency of lithium-ion batteries provides electric vehicles with a range of up to 150 km and can withstand up to 2000 recharge cycles.

events.name: Suitability for size and weight requirements
events.wd_label: Suitability for size and weight requirements
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries are suitable for applications where size and weight are important due to their small and light nature.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries are suitable for applications where size and weight are important due to their small and light nature.

events.name: Lithium battery market dynamics
events.wd_description: Factors affecting the price and market dynamics of lithium batteries, including supply shortages, political issues, technological advancements, and large-scale production.
events.description: Factors affecting the price and market dynamics of lithium batteries, including supply shortages, political issues, technological advancements, and large-scale production.

events.name: Price increase factors
events.wd_description: Factors that may increase the price of lithium batteries, such as a shortage in global supply of lithium and rare earth materials, and political problems in high production countries.
events.description: Factors that may increase the price of lithium batteries, such as a shortage in global supply of lithium and rare earth materials, and political problems in high production countries.

events.name: Price decrease factors
events.wd_description: Factors that may reduce the price of lithium batteries, such as improvements in battery technology and large-scale production.
events.description: Factors that may reduce the price of lithium batteries, such as improvements in battery technology and large-scale production.

events.name: Lithium reserves and growth potential
events.wd_description: Distribution of lithium reserves and the growth potential of rechargeable batteries using lithium compounds.
events.description: Distribution of lithium reserves and the growth potential of rechargeable batteries using lithium compounds.

events.name: Lithium reserves distribution
events.wd_description: Concentration of lithium reserves in South America, with Argentina, Chile, and Bolivia holding approximately 60% of the reserves, and Brazil having 0.5%.
events.description: Concentration of lithium reserves in South America, with Argentina, Chile, and Bolivia holding approximately 60% of the reserves, and Brazil having 0.5%.

events.name: Growth potential of rechargeable batteries
events.wd_description: Rechargeable batteries have the largest growth potential for lithium compounds due to their high demand and limited reserves.
events.description: Rechargeable batteries have the largest growth potential for lithium compounds due to their high demand and limited reserves.

events.name: Engine starting and functions
events.description: Battery power in an internal combustion vehicle is utilized for starting the engine and other functions such as electronic fuel injection, ignition, lights, and air conditioning.

events.name: Electric engine power supply
events.description: In electric vehicles, battery power is responsible for supplying power to the electric engine, replacing the fuel tank.

events.name: Suitability for machinery industry
events.description: After their use in electric vehicles, lithium-ion batteries can be used in machinery, replacing lead-acid batteries.

events.name: Recyclability of lithium batteries
events.description: Lithium batteries are fully recyclable, contributing to sustainability and the circular economy.

events.name: High concentration in South America
events.description: Approximately 60% of lithium reserves are concentrated in South America, specifically in Argentina, Chile, and Bolivia.
